decks.notes: The Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and efficient creature-based aggression, utilizing cards like Favored Hoplite, Monastery Swiftspear, and Tenth District Legionnaire to quickly pressure the opponent. Protection spells like Gods Willing and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance help ensure the creatures stick around while cards like Ancestral Anger and Monstrous Rage provide additional damage output. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of synergy and consistency to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed, aggression, and resilience.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and aggressively bring out Arclight Phoenix and utilize cheap spells like Consider, Fiery Impulse, and Lightning Axe to trigger its ability and bring it back from the graveyard. The deck also includes card draw spells like Opt and Treasure Cruise to keep the momentum going. With a focus on tempo and efficiency, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of flying threats and disruptive spells while maintaining card advantage with powerful draw engines.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By using efficient creatures like Knight-Errant of Eos and Venerated Loxodon, combined with disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control. Gleeful Demolition and Resolute Reinforcements provide additional ways to push damage through and close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, ensuring that the deck can consistently cast its powerful spells on curve.

This Mono Black Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and resources while generating value from graveyard interactions. It utilizes cards like Liliana of the Veil, Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Waste Not to control the game and create advantage. The deck also includes win conditions like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and The Meathook Massacre to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents through a combination of disruption, graveyard synergies, and powerful threats.

The key concept of this deck is to use sacrifice effects and recursion to continually generate value and drain the opponent's life total. By sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Unlucky Witness with Witch's Oven and Deadly Dispute, you can trigger abilities like Mayhem Devil and Bloodtithe Harvester to chip away at your opponent's life total. Cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Thoughtseize disrupt your opponent's strategy while also providing additional value for you. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional level of consistency to the deck.
